title: MIRA Metamodel Template Schema
description: MIRA metamodel templates give a high-level abstraction of modeling appropriate for many domains.

Concept.title: Concept
Concept.description:
A concept is specified by its identifier(s), name, and - optionally -
its context.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: An optional display name for the concept. If not provided, the name can be used for display purposes.

description.title: Description
description.description: An optional description of the concept.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: A mapping of namespaces to identifiers.

context.title: Context
context.description: A mapping of context keys to values.

Template.title: Template
Template.description: The Template is a parent class for model processes

rate_law.title: Rate Law
rate_law.description: The rate law for the template.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: The display name of the template.

ControlledConversion.title: ControlledConversion
ControlledConversion.description:
Specifies a process of controlled conversion from subject to outcome,
controlled by the controller.

rate_law.title: Rate Law
rate_law.description: The rate law for the template.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: The display name of the template.

display_name.description: The display name of the template.

GroupedControlledProduction.title: GroupedControlledProduction
GroupedControlledProduction.description: Specifies a process of production controlled by several controllers

rate_law.description: The rate law for the template.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: The display name of the template.

ControlledProduction.title: ControlledProduction
ControlledProduction.description: Specifies a process of production controlled by one controller

rate_law.description: The rate law for the template.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: The display name of the template.

display_name.description: The display name of the template.

ReversibleFlux.title: ReversibleFlux
ReversibleFlux.description: Specifies a reversible flux between a left and right side.

rate_law.title: Rate Law
rate_law.description: The rate law for the template.

display_name.description: The display name of the template.

left.title: Left
left.description: The left hand side of the flux.

right.title: Right
right.description: The right hand side of the flux.

NaturalProduction.title: NaturalProduction
NaturalProduction.description: A template for the production of a species at a constant rate.

rate_law.description: The rate law for the template.

display_name.description: The display name of the template.

NaturalDegradation.description: A template for the degradataion of a species at a proportional rate to its amount.

rate_law.description: The rate law for the template.

display_name.description: The display name of the template.

ControlledDegradation.description: Specifies a process of degradation controlled by one controller

display_name.description: The display name of the template.

GroupedControlledDegradation.description: Specifies a process of degradation controlled by several controllers

NaturalReplication.description: Specifies a process of natural replication of a subject.

StaticConcept.title: StaticConcept
StaticConcept.description: Specifies a standalone Concept that is not part of a process.

rate_law.title: Rate Law
rate_law.description: The rate law for the template.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: The display name of the template.

Distribution.title: Distribution
Distribution.description: A distribution of values for a parameter.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of distribution as provided by ProbOnto e.g. 'StandardUniform1', 'Beta1', etc.

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: The parameters of the distribution keyed by parameter names controlled by ProbOnto and values that are either floatingpoint values or symbolic expressions over other parameters.

Parameter.title: Parameter
Parameter.description: A Parameter is a special type of Concept that carries a value.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: An optional display name for the concept. If not provided, the name can be used for display purposes.

description.title: Description
description.description: An optional description of the concept.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: A mapping of namespaces to identifiers.

context.title: Context
context.description: A mapping of context keys to values.

distribution.title: Distribution
distribution.description: A distribution of values for the parameter.

Initial.title: Initial
Initial.description:
Represents the initial conditions for parameters present in the
model.

concept.title: Concept
concept.description: The concept associated with the initial.

Observable.title: Observable
Observable.description:
An observable is a special type of Concept that carries an expression.

Observables are used to define the readouts of a model, useful when a
readout is not defined as a state variable but is rather a function of
state variables.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: An optional display name for the concept. If not provided, the name can be used for display purposes.

description.title: Description
description.description: An optional description of the concept.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: A mapping of namespaces to identifiers.

context.title: Context
context.description: A mapping of context keys to values.

Author.title: Author
Author.description: A metadata model for an author.

Annotations.title: Annotations
Annotations.description:
A metadata model for model-level annotations.

Examples in this metadata model are taken from
https://www.ebi.ac.uk/biomodels/BIOMD0000000956,
a well-annotated SIR model in the BioModels database.

name.title: Name
name.description: A human-readable label for the model
name.example: SIR model of scenarios of COVID-19 spread in CA and NY

description.title: Description
description.example: The coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic has placed epidemic modeling at the forefront of worldwide public policy making. Nonetheless, modeling and forecasting the spread of COVID-19 remains a challenge. Here, we detail three regional scale models for forecasting and assessing the course of the pandemic. This work demonstrates the utility of parsimonious models for early-time data and provides an accessible framework for generating policy-relevant insights into its course. We show how these models can be connected to each other and to time series data for a particular region. Capable of measuring and forecasting the impacts of social distancing, these models highlight the dangers of relaxing nonpharmaceutical public health interventions in the absence of a vaccine or antiviral therapies.

license.title: License
license.description: Information about the licensing of the model artifact. Ideally, given as an SPDX identifier like CC0 or CC-BY-4.0. For example, models from the BioModels databases are all licensed under the CC0 public attribution license.

authors.title: Authors
authors.description: A list of authors/creators of the model. This is not the same as the people who e.g., submitted the model to BioModels

references.title: References
references.description: A list of CURIEs (i.e., <prefix>:<identifier>) corresponding to literature references that describe the model. Do **not** duplicate the same publication with different CURIEs (e.g., using pubmed, pmc, and doi)

time_scale.title: Time Scale
time_scale.description: The granularity of the time element of the model, typically on the scale of days, weeks, or months for epidemiology models

time_start.title: Time Start
time_start.description: The start time of the applicability of a model, given as a datetime. When the time scale is not so granular, leave the less granular fields as default, i.e., if the time scale is on months, give dates like YYYY-MM-01 00:00

time_end.title: Time End
time_end.description: Similar to the start time of the applicability of a model, the end time is given as a datetime. For example, the Bertozzi 2020 model is applicable between March and August 2020, so this field is annotated with August 1st, 2020.

locations.title: Locations
locations.description: A location or list of locations where this model is applicable, ideally annotated using a CURIEs referencing a controlled vocabulary such as GeoNames, which has multiple levels of granularity including city/state/country level terms. For example,the Bertozzi 2020 model was for New York City (geonames:5128581) and California (geonames:5332921)

pathogens.title: Pathogens
pathogens.description: The pathogens present in the model, given with CURIEs referencing vocabulary for taxa, ideally, NCBI Taxonomy. For example, the Bertozzi 2020 model is about SARS-CoV-2, this is ncbitaxon:2697049. Do not confuse this field with terms for annotating the disease caused by the pathogen. Note that some models may have multiple pathogens, for simulating double pandemics such as the interaction with SARS-CoV-2 and the seasonal flu.

diseases.title: Diseases
diseases.description: The diseases caused by pathogens in the model, given with CURIEs referencing vocabulary for dieases, such as DOID, EFO, or MONDO. For example, the Bertozzi 2020 model is about SARS-CoV-2, which causes COVID-19. In the Human Disease Ontology (DOID), this is referenced by doid:0080600.

hosts.title: Hosts
hosts.description: The hosts present in the model, given with CURIEs referencing vocabulary for taxa, ideally, NCBI Taxonomy. For example, the Bertozzi 2020 model is about human infection by SARS-CoV-2. Therefore, the appropriate annotation for this field would be ncbitaxon:9606. Note that some models have multiple hosts, such as Malaria models that consider humans and mosquitos.

model_types.title: Model Types
model_types.description: This field describes the type(s) of the model using the Mathematical Modeling Ontology (MAMO), which has terms like 'ordinary differential equation  model', 'population model', etc. These should be annotated as CURIEs in the form of mamo:<local unique identifier>. For example, the Bertozzi 2020 model is a population model (mamo:0000028) and ordinary differential equation model (mamo:0000046)

Time.title: Time
Time.description: A special type of Concept that represents time.

name.title: Name
name.description: The symbol of the time variable in the model.

units.title: Units
units.description: The units of the time variable.

templates.title: Templates
templates.description: A list of any child class of Templates

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.description: A dict of parameter values where keys correspond to how the parameter appears in rate laws.

initials.title: Initials
initials.description: A dict of initial condition values where keyscorrespond to concept names they apply to.

observables.title: Observables
observables.description: A list of observables that are readouts from the model.

annotations.title: Annotations
annotations.description: A structure containing model-level annotations. Note that all annotations are optional.

time.title: Time
time.description: A structure containing time-related annotations. Note that all annotations are optional.
